metadata.title: CVE-2018-14636 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Live-migrated instances are briefly able to inspect traffic for otherinstances on the same hypervisor. This brief window could be extendedindefinitely if the instance's port is set administratively down prior tolive-migration and kept down after the migration is complete. This ispossible due to the Open vSwitch integration bridge being connected to theinstance during migration. When connected to the integration bridge, alltraffic for instances using the same Open vSwitch instance wouldpotentially be visible to the migrated guest, as the required Open vSwitchVLAN filters are only applied post-migration. Versions of openstack-neutronbefore 13.0.0.0b2, 12.0.3, 11.0.5 are vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14636` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

neutron-common - 2:14.0.0~b1~git2018120609.2e720b158b-0ubuntu2
neutron-dhcp-agent - 2:14.0.0~b1~git2018120609.2e720b158b-0ubuntu2
neutron-l3-agent - 2:14.0.0~b1~git2018120609.2e720b158b-0ubuntu2
neutron-linuxbridge-agent - 2:14.0.0~b1~git2018120609.2e720b158b-0ubuntu2
neutron-macvtap-agent - 2:14.0.0~b1~git2018120609.2e720b158b-0ubuntu2
neutron-metadata-agent - 2:14.0.0~b1~git2018120609.2e720b158b-0ubuntu2
neutron-metering-agent - 2:14.0.0~b1~git2018120609.2e720b158b-0ubuntu2
neutron-openvswitch-agent - 2:14.0.0~b1~git2018120609.2e720b158b-0ubuntu2
neutron-plugin-ml2 - 2:14.0.0~b1~git2018120609.2e720b158b-0ubuntu2
neutron-server - 2:14.0.0~b1~git2018120609.2e720b158b-0ubuntu2
neutron-sriov-agent - 2:14.0.0~b1~git2018120609.2e720b158b-0ubuntu2
python3-neutron - 2:14.0.0~b1~git2018120609.2e720b158b-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: neutron package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:14.0.0~b1~git2018120609.2e720b158b-0ubuntu2').
